label: obj-asymmetric-rescale-function
name: Smooth Piecewise Rescale Function
mathematical_expression: g_A(z) := \begin{cases} \exp(z), & z \le 0 \\ \log(1 + z) + 1, & 0 < z < z_{\max} - 1 \\ P(z), & z_{\max} - 1 \le z \le z_{\max} \\ \log(1 + z_{\max}) + 1, & z > z_{\max} \end{cases}
definition: A function that transforms standardized Z-scores into positive values used for calculating fitness potential. It is constructed from exponential and logarithmic segments that are smoothly joined by a unique cubic polynomial patch, P(z), ensuring the overall function is continuously differentiable.
mathematical_properties: The function is C^1 smooth, monotonically non-decreasing, has a uniformly bounded range (0, g_A,max], and is globally Lipschitz continuous with a Lipschitz constant of approximately 1.0054. These properties ensure that the fitness potential is a well-behaved, stable function of the standardized scores.

typical_values.z_max: Must be a value greater than 1 for the piecewise definition to be well-posed.
